subject: Re: [junit] Ant/Junit/Package name issue?
msgSnippet: ... You need to specify the fully-qualified class name of your test case class when you execute the JUnit test runner, including the package name. ... -- J. B.
messageBody:
Baz ¤Ñª° wrote:

> All,
>
> This issue seems to be causing by the "package" name
> of the .java file. When removing the package name, the
> first line from the .java file, the Ant/Junit seems to
> respond well... Please read the output below... When
> the package name is in, then it complain the
> ClassLoader.

You need to specify the fully-qualified class name of your test case
class when you execute the JUnit test runner, including the package name.

Example:
> <test name="my.package.a.b.c.AlwaysWillFailTest" />
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
